      • options

        public static DiskCachedCellImgOptions options()
        Create default DiskCachedCellImgOptions.

        default DiskCachedCellImgOptions.

      • dirtyAccesses

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions dirtyAccesses(boolean dirty)
        Specify whether the image should use Dirty accesses. Dirty accesses track whether cells were written to. Only cells that were written to are (potentially) cached to disk.

        This is true by default.

        Parameters:
        dirty - whether the image should use Dirty accesses.

      • volatileAccesses

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions volatileAccesses(boolean volatil)

      • numIoThreads

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions numIoThreads(int numIoThreads)
        The specified number of threads is started to handle asynchronous writing of values that are evicted from the memory cache.
        Parameters:
        numIoThreads - how many writer threads to start (default is 1).

      • maxIoQueueSize

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions maxIoQueueSize(int maxIoQueueSize)
        Set the maximum size of the disk write queue. When the queue is full, removing entries from the cache will block until earlier values have been written.

        Because processing of removed entries is done whenever the cache is accessed, this may also block accesses to the cache. (This is a good thing, because it avoids running out of memory because entries cannot be cleared fast enough...)

        Parameters:
        maxIoQueueSize - the maximum size of the write queue (default is 10).

      • cacheType

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions cacheType(DiskCachedCellImgOptions.CacheType cacheType)
        Which in-memory cache type to use. The options are
        • SOFTREF: The cache keeps SoftReferences to values (cells), basically relying on GC for removal. The advantage of this is that many caches can be created without needing to put a limit on the size of any of them. GC will take care of balancing that. The downside is that OutOfMemoryError may occur because SoftReferences are cleared too slow. SoftReferences are not collected for a certain time after they have been used. If there is heavy thrashing with cells being constantly swapped in and out from disk then OutOfMemory may happen because of this. This sounds worse than it is in practice and should only happen in pathological situations. Tuning the -XX:SoftRefLRUPolicyMSPerMB JVM flag does often help.
        • BOUNDED: The cache keeps strong references to a limited number of values (cells). The advantage is that there is never OutOfMemory because of the issues described above (fingers crossed). The downside is that the number of cells that should be cached needs to be specified beforehand. So OutOfMemoryError may occur if many caches are opened and consume too much memory in total.
        Parameters:
        cacheType - which cache type to use (default is SOFTREF).

      • maxCacheSize

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions maxCacheSize(long maxCacheSize)
        Set the maximum number of values (cells) to keep in the cache. This is only used if cacheType(CacheType) is DiskCachedCellImgOptions.CacheType.BOUNDED.
        Parameters:
        maxCacheSize - maximum number of values in the cache (default is 1000).

      • cellDimensions

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions cellDimensions(int... cellDimensions)
        Set the dimensions of a cell. This is extended or truncated as necessary. For example if cellDimensions=[64,32] then for creating a 3D image it will be augmented to [64,32,32]. For creating a 1D image it will be truncated to [64].
        Parameters:
        cellDimensions - dimensions of a cell (default is 10).

      • cacheDirectory

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions cacheDirectory(Path dir)
        Set the path of the cell cache directory.

        This is null by default, which means that a temporary directory will be created.

        Do not use the same cell cache directory for two images at the same time. Set deleteCacheDirectoryOnExit(false) if you do not want the cell cache directory to be deleted when the virtual machine shuts down.

        Parameters:
        dir - the path to the cell cache directory.

      • tempDirectory

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions tempDirectory(Path dir)
        Set the path to the directory in which to create the temporary cell cache directory. This has no effect, if cacheDirectory(Path) is specified.

        This is null by default, which means that the default system temporary-file directory is used.

        Parameters:
        dir - the path to directory in which to create the temporary cell cache directory.

      • tempDirectoryPrefix

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions tempDirectoryPrefix(String prefix)
        Set the prefix string to be used in generating the name of the temporary cell cache directory. Note, that this is not the path in which the directory is created but a prefix to the name (e.g. "MyImg"). This has no effect, if cacheDirectory(Path) is specified.

        This is "imglib2" by default.

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the name of the temporary cell cache directory.

      • deleteCacheDirectoryOnExit

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions deleteCacheDirectoryOnExit(boolean deleteOnExit)
        Specify whether the cell cache directory should be automatically deleted when the virtual machine shuts down.

        This is true by default.

        For safety reasons, only cell cache directories that are created by the DiskCachedCellImgFactory are actually marked for deletion. This means that either no cacheDirectory(Path) is specified (a temporary directory is created), or the specified cacheDirectory(Path) does not exist yet.

        Parameters:
        deleteOnExit - whether the cell cache directory directory should be automatically deleted when the virtual machine shuts down.

      • initializeCellsAsDirty

        public DiskCachedCellImgOptions initializeCellsAsDirty(boolean initializeAsDirty)
        Specify whether cells initialized by a CellLoader should be marked as dirty. It is useful to set this to true if initialization is a costly operation. By this, it is made sure that cells are initialized only once, and then written and retrieve from the disk cache when they are next required.

        This is false by default.

        This option only has an effect for DiskCachedCellImg that are created with a CellLoader (DiskCachedCellImgFactory.create(long[], net.imglib2.type.NativeType, CellLoader)).

        Parameters:
        initializeAsDirty - whether cells initialized by a CellLoader should be marked as dirty.
